item.title: GMM Estimation of an ARMA(2,1) Model
item.description: In econometrics and statistics, the generalized method of moments (GMM) is a generic method for estimating parameters in statistical models. Usually it is applied in the context of semiparametric models, where the parameter of interest is finite-dimensional, whereas the full shape of the data’s distribution function may not be known, and therefore maximum likelihood estimation is not applicable. Today, we are trying to write a Generalizd Method of Moments estimation framework in Python, and use it to estimate an ARMA(2,1) time series.
